term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - multiplicative matrix effect
term.title: multiplicative matrix effect

item.text: Matrix effect that is proportional to the measured quantity value of the measurand.

notes.item: A multiplicative matrix effect can be compensated for by following a measurement procedure with standard addition.
A multiplicative matrix effect affects the slope, not the intercept, of a linear calibration curve.
The effect is sometimes termed "rotational matrix effect" or "proportional interference".
A multiplicative matrix effect may originate from non-analyte components of the measurement standard if these contribute to the signal attributed to the analyte.

sources.item: PAC, 2021, 93, 997. 'Metrological and quality concepts in analytical chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 2021)' on page 1013 (https://doi.org/10.1515/pac-2019-0819)
